 A mechanism is available for identifying specific pronunciation of words where
meaning of the words, in context, is ambiguous without knowing the
pronunciation. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ READABLE
PRONUNCIATION(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

A mechanism is available for identifying specific pronunciation of words where
meaning of the words, in context, is ambiguous without knowing the
pronunciation. 

These websites...

Make text content readable and understandable.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 Providing sound files of the pronunciation. 

A document includes some words whose meaning cannot be determined without
knowing the correct pronunciation. Each word is linked to a sound file that
gives the correct pronunciation. Users can select these links to find out how to
pronounce the words. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/pronunciation.html#examples] Web
Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
